item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4024)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4024)

item.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

summary.text:
States that in order to be considered credible the July 2013 parliamentary elections in Cambodia must: (1) implement the recommendations contained in the July 16, 2012, Report of the United Nations Special Rapporteur on the human rights situation in Cambodia; and (2) include the full participation of all political parties leaders, specifically Sam Rainsy.

Urges that any election in Cambodia that the Secretary of State determines is not credible should be deemed an illegitimate expression of the will of the Cambodian people and an impediment to Cambodia's democratic development.

States that a Cambodian government formed as a result of such illegitimate elections should not be eligible for direct U.S. assistance.

bill.title: A resolution calling for more accountable foreign assistance for Cambodia.

item.title: A resolution calling for more accountable foreign assistance for Cambodia.
A resolution calling for more accountable foreign assistance for Cambodia.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
